title: Le big rewrite
body:
A rewrite using async and Hyper with full support for multi-threaded test runs, multiple servers/endpoints and other goodies.

The old interface will still be accessible in this version, but will be marked as deprecated, since it still relies on the locking mechanism.

Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/92 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/94 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/144 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/150

Potentially closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/111 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/140 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/147

TODO:

- [x] Document the server
- [x] Add an HTTP2 test
- [x] Introduce an Error type
- [x] Check for unnecessary unwraps
- [x] Update the README
- [x] Update/remove the benchmark test
- [x] Introduce an error context

title: Handle httpparse error
body:
When httpparse fails to parse a request, it will return an error. For instance when a header is invalid, httparse will return error `Error::HeaderName`.
The current logic was to mark the error and re-enter the loop. When this happens, the buffer may be empty and the test will block indefinitely.

This change marks the request as `parsed` when httparse returns an error parsing the content so this can be returned back to the client.

title: Replace difference library with similar
body:
Replace difference library with similar because difference is no longer
maintained. See advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0095

Updated related tests due to slightly different diffing output.

Fixes #132

title: Update assert-json-diff to 2.0.0
body: I recently released assert-json-diff 2.0.0 which had [a few breaking changes](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200---2021-01-23).

title: Some changes to travis.yml and README
body: Small follow-up to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/134

title: Upgrade deps
body:
> mockito$ cargo upgrades
> All dependencies are up to date!

title: Fix clippy, option 2
body:
Hi, this is the second option to fix linting issues arisen in #128. This is **alternative** to #129.

A great shout out to @wolf4ood that concoted this solution. The details are in the last commit message, but the juice is the choice to compare only a part of the BodyFn bear by the `Body::Fn` variant.

title: Match binary body
Add a matched() -> bool method to mock
body:
Hi!

Thanks so much for this library - I really appreciate the work you've put into it! I have a slightly unusual use case surrounding testing async processing and I'd basically like to check to see if the mock has matched while not panicking. It looks like `mockito::mock` isn't `UnwindSafe` so catching the `assert` panic requires wrapping it in a `AssertUnwindSafe` which I'm not totally sure is correct.

This just provides a `matched` method that returns a bool for this particular use case. Let me know what you think/if it's appropriate or not!


Thanks!!!

title: Bump minimum supported Rust toolchain to 1.36
fix: use serde_urlencoded for query matching
body:
This is a fix that resolves #121 and also comes with a slightly leaner implementation of `Matcher::UrlEncoded`'s match arm in `Matcher::matches_value`

Open to any feedback / suggestions!

title: Improve Matcher display
body:
Hi! First off, thanks so much for the library - it's been *_super_* useful to me across several projects!

I was struggling with a test that had an `AllOf` match that wasn't matching, and in the error output I was getting:
```
> Expected 1 request(s) to:

GET /path?(all of)
accept: (any)
host: (any)
```
I thought it might be useful to be able to actually see all of the queries that were expected to match.

In doing so, I refactored the `Display` logic a bit to reduce some of what I thought were duplications.

There are tests that demonstrate the new output, but in summary, it looks like:
```
> Expected 1 request(s) to:

GET /path?(query1, query2 (regex), key3=val3 (urlencoded)) (all of)
accept: (any)
host: (any)
```
It seemed to follow the precedence and I'd be happy to make any changes to it.

Let me know if you have any questions, etc

Thanks!

title: Fix json in docs
body:
Fortunately, rust provides raw strings literals r#"..."#
which makes writing json literals very easy.

Also, I think doc strings and mocking examples should be tested as well. Just in case.

title: Warnings on missing .create()
body: As discussed in #112

title: Prefer assert_json_include_no_panic over deprecated version
body:
Closes #109 

Closes https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/issues/13

title: Update assert-json-diff version.
body:
Hi. We are using your library in our project https://github.com/tg-rs/tg-rs 

But suddenly found that CI can't pass tests.
```
error[E0432]: unresolved imports `assert_json_diff::Actual`, `assert_json_diff::Comparison`, `assert_json_diff::Expected`
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:565:46
    |
565 | use assert_json_diff::{assert_json_no_panic, Actual, Comparison, Expected};
    |                                              ^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^ no `Expected` in the root
    |                                              |       |
    |                                              |       no `Comparison` in the root
    |                                              no `Actual` in the root

error[E0061]: this function takes 3 parameters but 1 parameter was supplied
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:680:17
    |
680 |                 assert_json_no_panic(Comparison::Include(actual, expected)).is_ok()
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected 3 parameters

error[E0061]: this function takes 3 parameters but 1 parameter was supplied
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:687:17
    |
687 |                 assert_json_no_panic(Comparison::Include(actual, expected)).is_ok()
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected 3 parameters

error: aborting due to 3 previous errors

```


We found that source of problem was in [assert-json-diff#11](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/issues/11) library.

I have updated library in order to fix the build.
But i also found that method `assert_json_no_panic` is marked as `#[doc(hidden)]` so probably you should avoid using undocumented methods in future.

title: Set the 'connection: close' header
body: Closes #103

title: Bump dependency
body: Also `^` in Cargo doesn't do anything (it's the default behavior)

title: Fix Appveyor tests by disabling the color feature for Appveyor builds
Proposal: multiple mock matching
body:
This is an implementation proposal of the feature previously discussed in issue #97.

The idea is to detect if there is multiple mock matching the same request and calling them while the number of request expected is not reached. When it is reached we call the next one. If there is no more available we keep calling the last one.

title: add support for at_least and at_most
body: Add functions `expect_at_least` and `expect_at_most` as described in issue #79.

title: Check rustfmt as part of CI
Fix some edition idioms and run cargo fmt
body:
I noticed that you did some formatting changes in 3b519bb.

To make it easier for contributors to adhere to a common style, would you be willing to use `cargo fmt`?
This would also make the code more consistent with other codebases using the same tool.

title: Fix queries in the path as sub matchers + Cleanup
body: Fixes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/86

title: use the Rust 2018 edition
body: I have just done the minimum steps outlined in the [Edition guide](https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/editions/transitioning-an-existing-project-to-a-new-edition.html#updating-your-code-to-be-compatible-with-the-new-edition) without edition idiom migration

title: Move colored diff output to feature flag
body:
This allows one to use  this crate without bringing in the pretty big `colored` crate dependency and for when colored text diffs are not important.

The new `color` feature flag is enabled by default so no change in the default behavior
